abs: Given a high dimensional convex body K µ IRn by a separation oracle, we can approx- imate its volume with relative error ", using O⁄(n5) oracle calls. Our algorithm also brings the body into isotropic position. As all previous randomized volume algorithms, we use "rounding" followed by a multi- phase Monte-Carlo (product estimator) technique. Both parts rely on sampling (generating random points in K), which is done by random walk. Our algorithm introduces three new ideas: † the use of the isotropic position (or at least an approximation of it) for rounding, † the separation of global obstructions (diameter) and local obstructions (boundary problems) for fast mixing, and † a stepwise interlacing of rounding and sampling.
title: Random Walks And An O*(n⁵) Volume Algorithm For Convex Bodies
